==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|庚|口|c1=p|c2=s|t2=mouth|ls=psc}}.

唐 and [[庚]] were near-homophones in Old Chinese (唐 *[[w:International Phonetic Alphabet|(kə)-rˤaŋ]], 庚 *[[w:International Phonetic Alphabet|kˤraŋ]]; the OC initial for 唐 is less certain). 口 "mouth" refers to the older meaning "to exaggerate, to boast."
